text: cupcakes are a treat that everyone loves
even when we've swapped out some of the
ingredients for some healthier choices
like in this case with these lemon
yogurt cupcakes we're using some white
whole wheat flour in place of the
regular and we're using low-fat yogurt
in place of some of the fat and for a
final touch we're doing a naturally
tinted pink frosting first four
tablespoons of butter go into a mixer
make sure it's room temperature nicely
softened then three quarters of a cup of
sugar and get this mixing okay I'm gonna
stop this and add my lemon zest I like
to add the zest with the sugar the oils
will release from the zest and make a
very lemony cupcake I use one teaspoon
which is most of one lemon start mixing
while that's going I get my lemon juice
I love a recipe that uses both the zest
and the juice there's no waste let's see
I need two teaspoons lemon juice 1 egg 1
teaspoon vanilla extract ok now let's
get the dry ingredients ready cup and
3/4 of white whole wheat flour this is
just as nutritious as regular whole
wheat flour to the flour 1 and 1/4
teaspoons of baking powder 1/4 teaspoon
of baking soda and 1/2 teaspoon of
coarse salt just whisk it together and
just kind of aerate the mixture we also
have one and a half cups of low-fat
yogurt and that is going to alternate
with the flour into our butter mixture
on low speed I'm going to add about a
third of the flour mixture and then half
the yogurt another third of the flour
the rest of the yogurt this is going to
add a really nice moisture to the cake
and a great Tang rest of the flour do
not over mix this perfect I have my
cupcake pan it's all aligned with my
liners this recipe makes about 14
cupcakes so you can do two extra one
scoop for each it's about halfway out
the cup with batter
it's very light and airy batter which is
so nice just divide the batter okay good
so these go into a 350 degree oven for
about 18 minutes until they're golden
brown and they spring back when you
touch me
now for the frosting and this frosting
it does not have any food coloring but
it does have a beautiful pink color and
a really nice raspberry flavor so to
make that 3/4 cup of raspberries I'm
gonna puree them in the food processor a
tablespoon of sugar this couldn't be
easier this process until the all the
berries break down so just pass it
through a sieve we don't want the seeds
we just want the bright red raspberry
puree okay that's about all we need and
now we need to make our frosting this is
a super simple frosting just butter very
soft into the mixer one and a half
sticks get this going because the butter
was really soft it's already nice and
light and creamy and I think the key to
this frosting is to add the confectioner
sugar really slowly one spoon at a time
let it mix in I'm about halfway there
somebody raise the speed and give it a
good beat
that is looking good some more sugar and
the rest okay raise it up again looks
great nice and creamy now to make it
pink I'm gonna pour in the raspberry
puree okay our gorgeous pink frosting is
done our cupcakes are done and cooled
now we can frost it's about two
tablespoons per cupcake with this
billowy pink frosting I'm sure these
treats will bring a smile to anyone who
tries them
